name: Kinkaku-ji
description: Also known as the Golden Pavilion, this Zen Buddhist temple is a stunning structure with its top two floors completely covered in gold leaf. The building is set beautifully on a pond, reflecting its brilliant fa√ßade.

name: Arashiyama Bamboo Grove
description: A mesmerizing and tranquil natural wonder where towering stalks of bamboo seem to reach into the heavens. Visitors can stroll along a path, surrounded by the rustling sound of the bamboo stalks swaying in the breeze.

name: Fushimi Inari-taisha
description: This Shinto shrine is famous for its thousands of vibrant red torii gates that wind up the sacred Mount Inari. It is the head shrine of the god Inari and attracts visitors and pilgrims from all over the world.

name: Tokyo Skytree
description: The tallest structure in Japan, this broadcasting and observation tower offers spectacular panoramic views of Tokyo. Visitors can ascend to the observation decks for an unforgettable cityscape vista, especially at night.

name: Mount Fuji
description: Japan's highest and most sacred peak, Mount Fuji is an iconic symbol of the country and a UNESCO World Heritage site. Its perfectly symmetrical, snow-capped cone is a frequent subject in Japanese art and is a popular climbing destination.

name: Gion
description: Kyoto's most famous geisha district, known for its traditional wooden machiya houses and teahouses. Visitors often spot geiko (Kyoto dialect for geisha) and maiko (apprentice geisha) on their way to appointments, especially in the early evening.
